channel.title: XAMPP httpd service
channel.description: I need help with making my no-ip site load. I installed XAMPP and Apache is running, MySQL is running, and FileZilla is running. Mercury is not. When I go to my no-ip site, it says 'It Works!', but when other people go there, it says 'Oops! Google Chrome could not connect to ....' I portforwarded port 80 like a RSPS, but instead of the port being 43594 it's obviously 80. How could I make it work? Thanks.

item.title: XAMPP httpd service
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

AtomicInt_:

Test.no-ip.biz/website/index.html

That works for me. Not for other people.

Read full topic

item.title: XAMPP httpd service
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

RSCShadow:

C:/xampp/htdocs

My website:
C:/xampp/htdocs/website/index.html

That’s done I can see the page it all works out. I need to know how to port forward port 80.

Read full topic

item.title: XAMPP httpd service
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

Put your website files in the htdocs which is located inside of the xampp folder.

Read full topic

item.title: XAMPP httpd service
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

[quote=“ExtremeX-Scape™, post:6, topic:414902”][quote author=Fridder link=topic=516864.msg3753416#msg3753416 date=1316226348]

…
You seem to be explaining your problem wrong, please be more specific.

I’m trying to say that I’m the only one who can go to blah.no-ip.biz, meanwhile port 80 is portforwarded and all that xampp shit is set up. Why can’t other people connect to blah.no-ip.biz?
[/quote]

your website or whatever needs to be in the public folder which I believe is… htdocs?[/quote]

And how can I take my website and put it in the htdocs folder?
I don’t have some type of a folder that controls my .no-ip.com domain. I don’t understand what your trying to tell me to do.

Read full topic

item.title: XAMPP httpd service
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

ExtremeX-Scape™:

What folder is your site in?

What? I don’t know shit about stuff like this.

I just found this if it helps with anything…
Warning: mysql_connect() [function.mysql-connect]: Access denied for user ‘root’@‘localhost’ (using password: NO) in C:\xampp\htdocs\xampp\cds.php on line 64

Read full topic
